title: Traced and Tracked; or, Memoirs of a City Detective, etc
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: He had come upon him at the roadside near the city trying to remove the ragged coloured handkerchief with which he had bound up the ami, and which he was afraid might poison the wound. On getting this news I started for the South Side, and had got as far as Minto Street, when, looking up one of the quiet streets leading towards St Leonards, I saw a tramp seated on a gate step, and moved up to have a look at him. So minutely had the man been described to me, that I recognised him at a glance.
